com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics.barcode

Interface CodeEAN128Util

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BarcodeUtil, CodeEANUtil

    public interface CodeEAN128Util
extends CodeEANUtil
    Interface used to configure and draw an EAN 128 barcode.

    • Method Detail

      • setCheckDigitMarker

        void setCheckDigitMarker(char marker)
        Sets the character that will be used as the check digit marker.
        Parameters:
        marker - The character for the check digit marker.

      • setGroupSeparator

        void setGroupSeparator(char separator)
        Sets the group separator character.
        • Normally, either ASCII GS or 0xF1 is used.
        Parameters:
        separator - The group separator character.

      • setOmitBrackets

        void setOmitBrackets(boolean omit)
        Indicates whether brackets should be used in the human-readable part around the AIs.
        Parameters:
        omit - True if the brackets in the human-readable part should be omitted.

      • setTemplate

        void setTemplate(String template)
        Sets the message template with the fields for the EAN message.
        The format of the templates here is a repeating set of AI number (in brackets) followed by a field description. The allowed data types are "n" (numeric), "an" (alpha-numeric), "d" (date) and "cd" (check digit). Examples: "n13" defines a numeric field with exactly 13 digits. "n13+cd" defines a numeric field with exactly 13 digits plus a check digit. "an1-9" defines an alpha-numeric field with 1 to 9 characters.
        Parameters:
        template - A template like "(01)n13+cd(421)n3+an1-9(10)an1-20".

      • getCheckDigitMarker

        char getCheckDigitMarker()
        Returns the character used as the check digit marker.
        Returns:
        The check digit marker.

      • getGroupSeparator

        char getGroupSeparator()
        Gets the group separator character.
        • Normally, either ASCII GS or 0xF1 is used.
        Returns:
        The group separator character.

      • getOmitBrackets

        boolean getOmitBrackets()
        Gets whether brackets will be used in the human-readable part around the AIs.
        Returns:
        True if the brackets in the human-readable part will be omitted.

      • getTemplate

        String getTemplate()
        Gets the message template with the fields for the EAN message.
        Returns:
        The message template with the fields for the EAN message.
